In conclusion, the Noise Buds N1 are very well priced and for that price tag, you get a lot of features and decent performance. I have and would continue to recommend this product as a solid, reliable pair of wireless earbuds.

I recently purchased the Noise Buds X Prime, hoping to enjoy high-quality sound and a seamless wireless experience. Unfortunately, my experience has been quite disappointing, and here's why:Sound QualityThe most significant drawback of these earbuds is the sound quality. The audio output is subpar, lacking clarity and depth. The bass is weak, the mids are muddled, and the highs are harsh, making it difficult to enjoy any genre of music. Whether it's listening to music, watching videos, or taking calls, the audio performance is consistently underwhelming.Connectivity IssuesAnother major issue is the connectivity. Despite being advertised as truly wireless, the earbuds often struggle to maintain a stable connection with my device. There are frequent drops in the connection, and sometimes, one earbud disconnects while the other continues to play. This inconsistency is frustrating, especially during calls or while listening to music.Comfort and FitThe fit and comfort of the Noise Buds X Prime are also lacking. They tend to fall out easily, even with minimal movement, and wearing them for extended periods becomes uncomfortable. The earbuds don't provide a secure fit, which is crucial for both sound quality and convenience.Battery LifeBattery life is another area where these earbuds fall short. Despite claims of long-lasting battery life, I found myself needing to recharge them more frequently than expected. The battery drains quickly, particularly when using them for calls or streaming music.Build QualityThe build quality of the Noise Buds X Prime feels cheap and flimsy. The charging case and the earbuds themselves are made of low-quality plastic that doesn't inspire confidence in their durability. Additionally, the touch controls on the earbuds are not very responsive, making it difficult to control playback and volume.ConclusionOverall, the Noise Buds X Prime in-Ear Truly Wireless Earbuds fail to deliver on their promises. With poor sound quality, unreliable connectivity, uncomfortable fit, disappointing battery life, and low build quality, they do not offer good value for money. I would not recommend these earbuds to anyone looking for a reliable and high-quality wireless audio experience.
